text: Larry Willoughby (1947 â€“ January 14, 2021) was an American country music singer-songwriter and music businessman. He was the vice president of A&R; at Capitol Records. He was born in Sherman, Texas. Willoughby's debut album, Building Bridges, was released in 1984 by Atlantic America. Willoughby died of COVID-19 on January 14, 2021 in Sherman, Texas. ==References== Category:1947 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Texas Category:American country singers Category:American singer-songwriters Category:Businesspeople from Texas Category:Singers from Texas Category:Writers from Texas
title: Larry Willoughby
